# Description

My interests are in Life Sciences as a whole. I did my thesis on cardiovascular health, recently finished an internship on lichen diversity in and abundance in Rotterdam Zoo, and now currently looking for a job in the field of genetics.

Although I already had some knowledge about open science, I joined an open science event in TU Delft and that is where I learned more about it and was introduced to OSCR.

<!-- # Expertise -->

```{r radarPlot, eval = FALSE}

member_name <- "Leonardo Wada"
special_skill <- "literature search"

OS_skills <- read_csv(here("static/OS_skills.csv")) %>%
  dplyr::filter(name %in% c("max", "min", member_name)) %>%
  dplyr::select(c("reproducible analysis", "open source software", "data sharing", all_of(special_skill), "preregistration", "open access", "data management"))

# custom radar plot
radarchart(OS_skills,
  axistype = 0, seg = 10,
  pcol = alpha("#002328", 0.8), pfcol = alpha("#00B969", 0.6), plwd = 4, centerzero = TRUE, # polygon
  cglcol = "#7e7e7e", axislabcol = "#002328", caxislabels = seq(0, 10, 2), cglwd = 0.8 # grid
)

```
